article.headline: Monmouth 81, Loyola Marymount 53
article.story: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J. (AP) -- Jhamar Youngblood had a game-high 20 points -- one of four Monmouth players in double figures -- as the Hawks beat Loyola Marymount 81-53 on Sunday. Dejan Delic added 17 points for Monmouth (5-8), while Whitney Coleman had 15 and Marques Alston scored 13 points. The Hawks also had a dominant day on defense as the Lions hit just 34 percent of their shots and committed 21 turnovers. Adoyah Miller's 14 points led Loyola Marymount (8-8), while Damian Martin had 12 points and seven rebounds. Monmouth, which hit 57 percent of its shots -- including eight of its first nine shots -- led for most of the game but only held a 33-28 lead at the break. Jon Ziri then opened the second half with a 3-pointer to cut the lead to 33-31, but Monmouth then put the game away with a 24-0 run featuring fast break dunks by Coleman and Delic. Loyola Marymount did win the battle of the boards, outrebounding Monmouth 32-30.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
